title: The 😱 Screaming Face Emoji: Meaning, Design Inspiration & More

steps.title: Use the 😱 (screaming face) emoji to show you’re terrified or frightened.
steps.content: Use the 😱 (screaming face) emoji to show you’re terrified or frightened. If you’re texting a friend or posting about something that gave you the heebie-jeebies, illustrate how scary it was with the 😱 (screaming face) emoji. The emoji's blue forehead represents the color draining from your face with fear, and the open-mouthed shriek symbolizes absolute terror. [1] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source “I can’t handle scary movies, I was literally sitting in the theater like 😱 the whole time!” “It sounded like someone was trying to break in my front door 😱 but then I realized my roommate was just using the wrong key on accident.” If you’re scared but not totally horrified, use the 😨 (fearful face) or 😰 (anxious face with sweat) emojis instead—all 3 emojis can be used genuinely or jokingly.

steps.title: Express your shock, awe, or disbelief with 😱 (screaming face).
steps.content: Express your shock, awe, or disbelief with 😱 (screaming face). The 😱 (screaming face) emoji is the highest level of surprise you can describe through texting. Send it during your biggest “omg, WHAT!?” moments or when you get unbelievable news (bad or good). In this case, the emoji symbolizes someone grabbing their face with their mouth open in total shock. [2] X Research source “I got my audition results for the musical today and I got cast as the lead!? 😱” Them: “I CANNOT BELIEVE PARKER DUMPED JENNA” You: “😱😱😱”

steps.title: Show you’re excited or surprised with the 😱 (screaming face) emoji.
steps.content: Show you’re excited or surprised with the 😱 (screaming face) emoji. Sometimes, the 😱 (scream) emoji can be a good sign! Use it when you’re talking about something that truly excites you or when you get a pleasant surprise that really touches you. The content of your message will cue the reader that you’re using it in a positive way. [3] X Research source “The USA is in the World Cup this year!! 😱” “Marko threw me a surprise party for my birthday last night 😱❤️ He is so thoughtful!”

steps.title: Comfort a friend who experienced something scary.
steps.content: Comfort a friend who experienced something scary. If a pal sends you the 😱 (screaming face) emoji, show them some support over text or ask what happened. Chances are it’s not too serious if they’re telling you about it over text, but it’s always a good idea to offer some moral support! Use your knowledge of the person and their message to decide if it’s an earnest message or something jokey and lighthearted. [4] X Research source Them: “Omg, the spookiest thing just happened to me 😱” You: “Oh no! Are you alright? What happened?” Them: “Guess which coworker I just ran into at Marshall’s 😱” You: “Not Brenda! 😱😱”

steps.title: Reciprocate your friend’s excitement, surprise, or disbelief.
steps.content: Reciprocate your friend’s excitement, surprise, or disbelief. The 😱 (screaming face) emoji indicates strong feelings (good or bad), so the sender is probably looking for a validating reaction. Let them know you’re equally as surprised or excited, you’re also stunned by their news, or offer some more details if you have insight into their surprising situation. Them: “You’re not gonna believe who I saw eating at Alinea tonight 😱” You: “Who??” Them: “LADY. GAGA.” You: “WHAT!? 😱😱😱” Them: “I can’t believe Jordan is employee of the month again 😱🙄 I don’t understand it!” You: “Right!? I heard it’s because their dad is friends with the manager 😑”

steps.title: The 😱 (screaming face) emoji is based on Edvard Munch’s The Scream.
steps.content: The 😱 (screaming face) emoji is based on Edvard Munch’s The Scream . The Scream was painted in 1893 and is considered a masterpiece that influenced the Expressionist movement in art and symbolizes the anxiety of the human condition. The original painting features a figure with a gaunt, yellowish-brownish face with wide eyes, a mouth open in a silent scream, and both hands clasped to the sides of its face. In some ways, The Scream can be considered the original emoji. [5] X Trustworthy Source Greater Good Magazine Journal published by UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center, which uses scientific research to promote happier living Go to source The emoji’s blue forehead represents a cold sweat (like when you're upset, sad, or afraid) and comes from an anime and manga illustration technique. [6] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source The 😱 (screaming face) emoji shows that images can be an important part of written language. It’s difficult to write “scream” without thinking of The Scream . Some paintings, like da Vinci’s Mona Lisa or van Gogh’s Sunflowers , are famous for their beauty while The Scream is loved for its brutal, raw emotion.
